org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface DependencyErrorHandler


  • public interface DependencyErrorHandler
    Defines an error handler to be called instead of the associated node computation when the node is not being executed due to a failed dependency.

    Thread safety

    Instances must have the same thread-safety property as the computation of the associated task node.

    Synchronization transparency

    Instances are not expected to be synchronization transparent and are called in the same context as the associated computation would have been.
    See Also:
    TaskNodeProperties.tryGetDependencyErrorHandler()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleDependencyError(CancellationToken cancelToken, TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey, Throwable error)
      Called when the associated node cannot be executed due to a dependency failure.

    • Method Detail

      • handleDependencyError

        void handleDependencyError(CancellationToken cancelToken,
                           TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey,
                           Throwable error)
                    throws Exception
        Called when the associated node cannot be executed due to a dependency failure. This handler is called on the same executor the associated node's computation would have been called on.

        The graph execution is not considered completed before this method returns.

        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the cancellation token signaling the cancellation of the associated task graph execution. This argument cannot be null.
        nodeKey - the TaskNodeKey identifying the node associated with the failure. This argument cannot be null.
        error - the error causing the failure of the node execution. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown in case of some serious failure. The thrown exception will be suppressed by the error causing this method to be called.
